title.title: Jacob Hermann an Nicolaus I Bernoulli. Frankfurt (Oder), 16. Mai 1716
1716.05.16: Hermann, Jacob (1678-1733) an Bernoulli, Nicolaus (1687-1759)
1716-05-16_Hermann_Jacob-Bernoulli_Nicolaus
Basler Edition der Bernoulli-Briefwechsel

note.p: Am Briefkopf von anderer Hand mit anderer Tinte "Francof. 16 Maj. 1716

listChange.change: Formeln korrigieren um Validierungsprobleme zu beheben

opener.salute:
Viro Eruditissimo atque Clarissimo
Nicolao Bernoulli Gen. J. U. C.
Jac. Hermannus S. P. D.

div.p:
Mitto nunc Tibi oportuna mihi oblata occasione promissam Celeberr. Patrui Tui b. m. enumerationem
locorum hypersolidorum àa me ipso diligenter ex meo apographo transcriptam, quam huic epistolio
annexam vides.Die hier genannte, für Johann I Bernoulli bestimmte, Beilage fehlt.

In postremis meis literis exhibui quidem curvam x^{4}+\frac{2}{3}aaxx+\frac{4}{3}xxyy-\frac{1}{3}a^{4}=0, isti vis centralis
legi quam mihi proposueras G=\frac{z^{3}+\overline{aa-2zz}\sqrt{aa+zz}}{zz}G=\frac{z^{3}+(aa-2zz)\sqrt{aa+zz}}{zz} satisfacientem, sed quia minus belle tunc
valebam modum ipsum quo æaequationem illam ex generalibus meis formulis elicueram transcribere
non potui quem tamen potissimum àa me exigere videbaris. Fateor hoc exemplum non inepte elec-
tum esse in tentationem, cum quantitas \frac{\overline{aa-2zz}}{zz} dz \sqrt{aa+zz}\frac{(aa-2zz)}{zz} dz \sqrt{aa+zz} prima fronte haud integrabilis videatur
etsi revera integrari possit. Hoc pacto facile quis induci posset ut crederet curvam quæaesitam algebraï-
cam esse non posse., in hac ipsa primum opinione fui priusquam rem totam ad meas formulas exegissem.
En totum processum! cum formulæae tuæae insit quantitas \sqrt{aa+zz}, pono generaliter A=z^{\alpha}E^{\epsilon},Das "z" erscheint in der Handschrift manchmal grösser, es ist aber gemäss Phronomia, §169 davon auszugehen, dass ein kleines z gemeint ist. Dies ist jedoch noch eingehender zu prüfen, da die Spiesstranskription ein Z angegeben hat. positâa
E=a+bz^{\beta}, et faciendo insuper H=\alpha a+\overline{\alpha+\beta\epsilon} \cdot bz^{\beta}H=\alpha a+(\alpha+\beta\epsilon) \cdot bz^{\beta}, I = \overline{\alpha\alpha-\alpha}\cdot aa + \overline{\beta\beta\epsilon +2 \alpha\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\alpha-\beta\epsilon-2\alpha} \cdot abz^{\beta}+I = (\alpha\alpha-\alpha)\cdot aa + (\beta\beta\epsilon +2 \alpha\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\alpha-\beta\epsilon-2\alpha) \cdot abz^{\beta}+
+ \overline{\beta\beta\epsilon\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+\alpha\alpha-\beta\epsilon-\alpha}\cdot bbz^{2\beta}+ (\beta\beta\epsilon\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+\alpha\alpha-\beta\epsilon-\alpha)\cdot bbz^{2\beta}; K=\alpha aa + \overline{\beta\beta\epsilon+\beta\epsilon+2\alpha}\cdot abz^{\beta}+\overline{\beta\epsilon+\alpha}\cdot bbz^{2\beta}K=\alpha aa + (\beta\beta\epsilon+\beta\epsilon+2\alpha)\cdot abz^{\beta}+(\beta\epsilon+\alpha)\cdot bbz^{2\beta}.
L=\overline{\alpha\alpha+2\alpha}\cdot aa+\overline{2\beta\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\alpha+2\beta\epsilon+4\alpha}\cdot abz^{\beta}+\overline{\beta\beta\epsilon\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+\alpha\alpha+2\beta\epsilon+2\alpha}\cdot bbz^{2\beta}L=(\alpha\alpha+2\alpha)\cdot aa+(2\beta\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\alpha+2\beta\epsilon+4\alpha)\cdot abz^{\beta}+(\beta\beta\epsilon\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+\alpha\alpha+2\beta\epsilon+2\alpha)\cdot bbz^{2\beta}.
M=\overline{\alpha\alpha+\alpha}\cdot aa + \overline{\beta\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\alpha+\beta\epsilon+ 2\alpha}\cdot abz^{\beta}+\overline{\beta\beta\epsilon\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+\alpha\alpha+\beta\epsilon+\alpha}\cdot bbz^{2\beta}M=(\alpha\alpha+\alpha)\cdot aa + (\beta\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+2\alpha\alpha+\beta\epsilon+ 2\alpha)\cdot abz^{\beta}+(\beta\beta\epsilon\epsilon+2\alpha\beta\epsilon+\alpha\alpha+\beta\epsilon+\alpha)\cdot bbz^{2\beta}. Eruntque B = z^{\alpha-1}E^{\epsilon-1}H et
C = Iz^{\alpha-2}E^{\epsilon-2}, et denique G=\frac{1}{z^{3}}-\frac{nnKE}{H^{3}z^{3}}\pm \frac{nneL}{H^{3}E^{\epsilon-1}z^{\alpha+3}}+\frac{nnssM}{H^{3}E^{2\epsilon-1}z^{2\alpha+3}}. Quæae invenitur salvo calculo substituendo
in generali formula §. 169 Phoron. (sed correcta mutato membro AB^5 z in numeratore, in AB^2 z) supra inventos valores mag-
nitudinum A, B, et C. Si nunc faciam \alpha = -1, \beta = 2, et \epsilon=\frac{1}{2}, erunt H=-a, E=a+bzz, I=2aa+3abzz,
K=-aa+abzz; L=-aa+2abzz, et M=abzz, unde substituendo hos valores in Canone erit,
G ut \frac{\overline{1-nn}aa,+bb-bss\cdot nnz^{4}}{z^{3}}\pm\frac{\overline{nnae\mp2nnbezz}\sqrt{a+bzz}}{zz}\frac{(1-nn)aa,+bb-bss\cdot nnz^{4}}{z^{3}}\pm\frac{(nnae\mp2nnbezz)\sqrt{a+bzz}}{zz}, qui canon facile ad Tuum reducitur faciendo n=1, s=0, b
=e=1 et ponendo aa pro a, nam hisce præaestitis fit omnino G ut \frac{z^{3}\pm\overline{aa\mp2zz}\sqrt{aa+zz}}{zz}\frac{z^{3}\pm(aa\mp2zz)\sqrt{aa+zz}}{zz} quæae cum suis signis superiorib[us]us
est ipsissima Tua formula. Erit ergo hoc casu E(a+bzz)=aa+zz, et A(=z^{\alpha}E^{\epsilon})=\frac{\sqrt{aa+zz}}{z}. porro qui n=1, et (§. 168 Ph.)
1 : n = \mu : \nu, erit etiam \mu=\nu=1, adeoque æaequatio generalis §. 168 huic casui applicata fit Sx=rz, est vero S(=
=\frac{rr}{A\mp e})=\frac{z}{\sqrt{aa+zz}\mp z}, adeoque \frac{xz}{\mp z+\sqrt{aa+zz}}=z, atque adeo x=\sqrt{aa+zz}\mp z, hinc \begin{aligned} & x^{4} + \begin{array}{l} \displaystyle \frac{2}{3} aaxx \end{array} - \frac{1}{4} a^{4} = 0 \\ & \quad + \displaystyle \frac{4}{3} yy \end{aligned}. Quæae est æaequatio
Curvæae quæaesitæae. Alio adhuc modo et forte multis aliis viis eadem hæaec æaequatio ex meis generalibus formulis elici po-
tuisset, sed brevitatis studio hisce supersedeo. Fortasse hanc viam tanquam nimis prolixam ridebis, quod tamen
nil moror, in ea enim extensione res simplicius exhiberi nequeunt; late vero patentem ejusmodi formulam parti-
cularem dare volui ut non semper necesse sit ad singula nova exempla prolixum calculum subducere; revera
enim exemplum istud præaeter illud quod §. 170 adduxi et in variis curvis jam cognitis illustravi, infinita alia
continet. Me etiam tacente vides, quod etiam canon G=\frac{\pm aa\mp2zz\sqrt{aa+zz}}{zz} sit ad curvam algebraicam, cujus
scil. æaequ. est x^{4}+aaxx+2xxyy-\frac{1}{4}a^{4}=0. Taceo innumeras observationes quæae in præaecedentem formulam
fieri possunt, quæae tamen omnes insigniter illustrarent amplissimum usum et Universalitatem solutionis
meæae inversi Problematis Virium centralium pro Curvis Algebraicis.

Celeberr. Patruus Tuus proposuit mihi Problema inveniendi scalam Virium ex data scala temporum
cum scil. mobile ex quolibet axis puncto descensum àa quiete incipit, ita ut ordinatæae scalæae temporum expri-
mant tempus respectivum quo quæaelibet abscissa ordinatæae cuilibet in scala temporūum homologa, cadendo absol-
vitur. Hoc problema equidem facile est si scala temp. sit aliqua Parabola cujuscunque gradus
et difficillimum si sit curva cujuscunque alterius generis, ita ut non putem quemquam scalam Virium datu-
rum esse etsi non me lateat aliquam ejus proprietatem vel quam habere debeat indolem nominari posse.
Saltem Cel. Patruus Tuus non scribit solutionem generalem sibi in potestate esse. Sed plura jam super
hæaec scribere non vacat.

postscript.p: P. S. Cel. Professori Patruo Tuo plurimam meam salutem impertiaris rogo etiam atque etiam.
